pr_title: Add Latency Metrics to Performance Tests

timeline.message:
Add Latency stats to aceptance and performance subscribe logs

Signed-off-by: Nana-EC <56320167+Nana-EC@users.noreply.github.com>

Updated to print total stats and k8s job

Signed-off-by: Nana-EC <56320167+Nana-EC@users.noreply.github.com>

Update acceptance tests to use first 8 bytes of message for transaction publish time

Signed-off-by: Nana-EC <56320167+Nana-EC@users.noreply.github.com>

Cleaned up a bit

Signed-off-by: Nana-EC <56320167+Nana-EC@users.noreply.github.com>

timeline.bodyText: Longs.toByteArray(). But more importantly, why are we converting the long to bytes and then to string? What's wrong with instantRef.toEpochMilli().toString()?
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText:
This was to align with the engineering perf tests that put the long timestamp in the first 8 bytes explicitly.
I can add a comment and check the optimization in a future PR
replies.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText: But it's not getting the first 8 bytes of the message, it's taking an Instant's epoch millis and converting it to bytes and then strings.
replies.author: steven-sheehy
